comment: I took prof. Jones for a summer semester. She gives great feedback on projects/ ideas and is open to most topics chosen for the research paper. There is one final paper but assignments given will prepare you for the entire thing. Easy to get in contact with and will even have over the phone meetings with you if your schedules aren't compatible.

Depending on what you're in school to do, get an education or fly under the radar, and the amount of time and attention you put in to your education will greatly affect the outcome of this class.  Professor Jones has a good deal of wisdom to impart, she thinks outside the box, and is willing to impart her wide range of knowledge.

To get an A in the class: - Ask for help and feedback when writing your paper.  - Schedule meetings with her - she is super flexible  - Go to class and do the simple assignments - Do not wait until the last minute to get started on your research

I enjoyed her class a lot. She's very passionate about material.  She assigns a lot of papers so get ready to write. However, the topics are pretty interesting and even controversial.  I would take her again for sure.

She does not grade too hard, but you do have to try. gives you a few papers and a few quizzes over the text . she is very willing to help you and makes some funny and quirky remarks. overall it was pretty easy to get an A as long as you did your work and turned things in on time.

Professor Jones is a really great teacher! She gives out her phone number so you can text her with questions at almost any point in the day. Her papers were not long or hard. She cancels class a lot which is both good and bad because work starts to pile up. Grades aren't put in until like 2 days before they are due. Over all would  take her again.
Very Laid back.
She is very nice and helpful, however she cancels class often and that catches up and assignments begin to pile up.

The books read in this class are not easy to comprehend. The tests are like 10 pages long and are not easy. Definitely go to all of her extra credit study sessions, and write the extra credit papers. Her lectures are all over the place. She is really funny, easy going, and also very knowledgeable.

CLASS TAKEN: World Lit  LECTURES: Confusing. Does not make points very clear.   HOMEWORK: Just reading. Not much other homework is given.   GRADING: Pretty lenient grader. Gives 1/2 credit and all of that.   TESTS/QUIZES: 3/4 Tests are tough. Only 2 quizes, pop quizes.   Overall good teacher, just ask her to be specific on what she want

This class was terriable. She is literally all over the place and her notes can not be read at all. Her test are crazy long, like 5-10 pages and most of the time they have little to do with the book that you even read. Very unorgonized. 4 test that pretty much make up your whole grade. Avoid this class at all cost.

Professor Jones proved to be an easy class. We didn't get a single grade in the grade book until the end of October which is scary. She's a little scattered and unorganized but overall she knows her stuff. She cancels class a lot. Very understanding when it comes to getting behind. She offers office hour times to catch up. Miss 5 classes & fail.

She is probably one of the best professors at KSU! She really tries to build a relationship with her students, which is something that you don't get in college. She is an extremely laid back person and she often shows this in her class. She tries to help you as much as possible. Even though she does all of this, you must be prepared to work to pass

I took her for 1101 and 1102. She's a great teacher. Very knowledgeable. Not the most organized but she's fair, if she misplaces your work she will give you credit. Being part of  her lectures are key. You will learn more from hearing her tell stories and randomly talk vs. reading the text. Shes fun and genuinely wants her students to do well.

She's awesome! She is passionate about her subject and passionate about her students! The class is an easy A- if you do well on the paper. She doesn't assign much so do what she does assign and turn it in on time! It's very manageable and a good class to take with her if you have something difficult like Calc 1 or 2 or Bio or something.

She's a wonderful English Professor. Any help you need, she'll help all that she can. Attendance is a must. Each class she introduces helpful material, that will be beneficial for your final paper. There are two quizzes, around 8 major assignments (fairly easy), a major final paper (350 pts). The paper have to be at least 5 pages. Start  it ASAP

Professor Jones was overall a very helpful professor in class. If you were to contact her for help, she would be more than happy and even take it into consideration down the line should your grade start to suffer. Her paper topics were pretty boring, but she nearly writes it for you with her templatesoutlines. Decent with uploading grades.
Great teacher. Kind of boring. Knows what shes talking about however. Very helpful although confusing at times. Grades tough, papers always over 1100 words. Overall, shes great!

She is a very interesting professor. She goes on rants about things that seem very random, but the class overall was pretty easy if you do your work. Im taking her again next semester by choice, so that shows something. She's friendly and will help you with whatever you need.
Prof Jones is good but tough. If you pay attention during lectures, read the book, and do your assignments, you will do okay.

Professor Jones is a great professor. She is hard, and she expects each student to work on a college level. I took her for the summer semester, so the class moved quickly. Take notes as she does lectures and you will be able to write papers with a better understanding of what she wants. Also, get Everything's an Argument; it will help you!

Ms. Jones made this class a complete nightmare this semester. Be prepared to have hundreds of emails flooding your inbox, extremely difficult tests, pages of useless notes being thrown at you, just to name a few issu

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. The amount of homework she gives and the way she grades is ridiculous for a general education class. She says you'll only have one essay the entire class, but really you will have several small essays almost every week throughout the semester that become very tedious. SOOOO much homework, at least 3 assignments a night.
She grades your paper like if you need to be a scholar writer.
She grades your paper like if you need to be a scholar writer. Gave me a D because she counted the points wrong. She changed it to a C at the last minute. Don't take her! Grades way to hard.

Great professor. Not always clear with her assignments, but cuts people a break when its her fault. Allows assignments to be turned in late with points deducted. Very interesting lectures just make sure you read and attend class. Holds study sessions and helps students during office hours. I loved this class it was very interesting & easy to follow
VERY HARD. She expects a lot. Not an easy A. You have to work VERY hard to earn a decent grade.
Ms. Jones was a very engaging professor. She made it clear what she wanted to see on our papers, and was very generous on our grading if you followed her rules.

Professor Jones definitely knows what she's talking about. She is very passionate about the class and it's obvious she wants her students to succeed. She is the most unorganized teacher I've ever had, but she eventually gets everything done. She makes herself available for extra help and grades fairly. Highly recommend.

For World Lit she is amazing. She's very passionate and caring about her job. She obviously cares and is always willing to work with you. Study sessions before tests, which are mostly short answer. There are some readings but easy and she goes over them in class. She has good advice and makes you think. I really respect and like her, she's fun too!

Prof. Jones is a very interesting teacher. She isn't hard, it's just the massive work load. If you enjoy having hours of homework, take her. Very-unorganized and is sometimes unclear with what she wants in papers. The reading prompts she gives us in class opens a new perspective on things. Jones will keep you entertained. (sometimes):)

I really enjoyed Mis. Jones' class. She may be more difficult than most professors, but she is always willing to help. Her class is extremely interesting and I would love to take another class from her again.

I loved this class! Prof Jones connects literature to history, music, art, philosophy - EVERYTHING! The readings were interesting and She makes you look at things differently and helps you relate to the readings personally and ties them to contemporary issues. She's not easy, but the work is worth it and fun.

So sweet and so smart! Professor Jones is an absolutely wonderful person. She has a very laid-back attitude but is very serious about writing. Her class was surprisingly eye-opening for an English class. It felt more like a really cool philosophy class. Loved it and loved her.
Very helpful, notes are scattered but she will clarify if asked.

If you hate busy work as much as I do, you do not want to take this class. She is extremely unorganized and loads you up with massive amounts of work. She does offer office hours to edit your major papers but this class is very time consuming and she is often not clear about due dates. Overall, take someone else if possible.

TAKE HER. Professor Jones will make you a better writer. There is a lot of work at the beginning of the semester, but hang in there. She walks you through all of it and every class will be so much easier because of her. She is interesting, funny and very helpful. Office hours will raise your letter grade. She is the BEST.

Professor Jones has to be my favorite professor this semester. She's extremely intelligent and always has a clever word to put in about her students and their retorts. If you are willing to talk to her and get the help you need, a normally very difficult class is a breeze. I'm not even what you would call "english minded" and I love her class!!

She is a great teacher!! English has never been my best subject and she has helped me grow so much. She is willing to work with you and encourages you to ask questions. If you do the work, you should be fine. I encourage you to go to her office hours! She will look over your paper and correct it which is helpful since she is the one grading it!

She is very nice and a good teacher. Also extremely intelligent. The only thing I would say is that she is very unorganized. VERY. But overall a good teacher. I would recommend taking her if you don't mind someone who is unorganized.

Professor Jones is highly intelligent, there's no question about it. She gives thought provoking lectures and is a joy to listen to. However, her tests are increasingly difficult and there is an immense work load. Be prepared to spend a majority of your free time on homework from this class.

Professor Jones is brilliant. She's a genius and interesting as hell, I go to her class just to hear her talk. I love her sense of humor and as well, she's my favorite professor this semester. I highly recommend her. Not the easiest class you'll take, but it's English so that has to be expected. If you want a good professor, pick this one.

Amazing prof is clear & concise about what she wants. She will challenge your personal point of view not to be mean but to really get you to think. She wants you to not take things at face value but know how to back up your thinking. This is what writing is about! Easy if you do the work. Would HIGHLY recommend as she truly teaches and helps u ASK!

She is NOT organized, which bothered me a lot because I'm the organized type; she is very scatter minded. But other than that she is for the most part clear in what she wants, though I wish she would have come up with rubrics. She is open minded to your thoughts and ideas and she is somewhat helpful.

I had her for Summer semester, and she just wasn't for me. For as long as I stayed, it seemed that as long you read the material and put thought into your response, you'd receive a decent grade. What had drove me away from her  class were her opinions, and how she would impose them onto her students. If you do voice your own opinion, be prepared.

Class seems intimidating, but it isn't as bad as you think. She;s very helpful. GO TO OFFICE HOURS. After a while, people will notice how helpful her office hours are and her time is valuable! I recommend her. You'll learn a lot. Her notes can be confusing, but ask her if you don't understand something.
She's incredibly smart, and totally damn hot! I wish I could take another class with her again.

Very un-organized.  Fifth week in school and still have not received any graded papers back.  Did not show you how to do MLA.  Had to figure that out on your own.  She is more into analyzing authors works, than teaching you how to write a paper
Prof. Jones is a great she spends extra time outside of class to make sure your paper is perfect. She is not easy but if you go to her for help your almost guaranteed an A!

Her class is definitely not your high school English course- it is much more challenging but I am a better writer because of it. DEFINITELY take advantage of meeting with her one on one to go over papers- she is the one grading your paper in the end, so she edits it the way she thinks it needs to be (and you will end up with a better grade!)
Good professor....distracted and not organized but over all pretty good.

Prof. Jones knows about the most random things, which makes her class really fun. She has you write a lot and read odd essays, but I got better at writing b/c of this. She's slow to give back papers, but her comments and corrections are worth the wait. Seriously, take her.
she is really nice and helpful :) you just have to put some efforts on your assignment :) i would take her if i have another chance :D

Professor Jones is great!She's nice, laid back, and very understanding if you accidentally forget to bring something to class. Very helpful if you come to her with a question. She's a philosophical kind of person who sometimes say things just because they're out of the box and get you to think. She tries to keep class intersting. I recommend her!
PLEASE AVOID. SHITLOAD OF HOMEWORK AND YOU WILL HAVE NO LIFE.
She is a great professor. HELPS YOU A LOT! Class can be hard at moments, but just ask her anything you are confused about. She will be more than happy to answer.

She is a very nice woman and will help if you ask for it, but she is never completely clear on what shes looking for in essays. Her lessons are always scattered because she likes to shift from topic o topic then back to the original topic. Overall she's decent... shes strict on her attendance policy though.
Amazing teacher!! She is super nice and absolutely hilarious! Gives you so many opportunities for individual help. She grades a little hard but always gives you a chance to revise.

She is a very wonderful, helpful teacher,but she is very scatterbrained. It was very hard for her to focus on one thing.On book usage, she does use the book very often. We have quizzes, but most questions are critical thinking, so take GOOD notes. You will be writing essays every month.Use writing lab. Wasn't very hard. Probably made B. Recommended

Prof. Jones is so nice!! She is very understanding and she walks you through every assignment. Um, I don't know why people are saying you don't use the book. Prof. Jones DOES use the book, and she gives quizzes on it. She gives study guides, too, and don't take advantage of that. That is really so, SO helpful and kind of her. Take her! :)
Prof Jones is one of the best English teachers on campus. She helps with writing and correction of essays. She is also vry understanding. Please take her.

Easy A! Explains everything, no book use, gives a chance to re-edit any paper you did not do very well! Easy A all around! If you have a reason you are failing she will work with you to get an A. Some have not come to class and she even worked with them to help them pass the class! She works hard to get her students to pass and understand the class
Good teacher, willing to meet with you outside of class to help. Class is never boring. Really don't use book that much despite what she says
She is so nice. She loves her job. She has a dark sense of humor. She is willing to make meetings to go over your paper. 3 major papers. Never used the book.

Amazing Prof! She is very willing to answer any questions and meet outside of class. I found the papers to be very interesting and she gives plenty of time and steps to do them. Overall, she is a wonderful teacher and person. PS:Don't bother with the books, I only used one once.

Professor Jones was an excellent English professor! You have about 3 papers and those are the majority of your grade. She allows you to make appts with her before the paper is due to go over your rough draft which i HIGHLY recommend bc she gives you very useful feedback. NEVER used the book. Overall a pretty good, helpful professor!

This professor is really nice and down to earth, but she definitely expects college level effort. Didn't use (need) any of the books. Semester was 3 large papers and homework responses. A lot of peer review!! I'd say this is a hard class to get an A in.. dont take for easy gened class

All of her lectures are very interesting.  She is very helpful when writing papers, willing to meet with you outside of class to edit it.  I didn't buy the book and we never used it.  Great professor, take her!
She is kind of scatter brained, but she is very intelligent, interesting and kind. Gives you many chances to succeed in her class.

I had Professor Jones my first year and I loved her. There are no test, but a lot of papers. Her lectures are fun and extremely interesting. She is willing to work with you, I met her at starbucks twice for her to look at my paper. Her and her way of thinking is unique and out of the box. If you have a chance to take her class, DO IT!

Jones is a very interesting professor. Dark sense of humor, very intelligent, deep discussions that are also fun. She gives a lot of time for writing papers, and in the meanwhile goes out of her way to help write them. I enjoyed her class. Highly recommend.

Seriously out of the box lesson plans that can get really off topic, but with good intentions.  She gives a LOT of papers, but also gives a lot of opportunities to get a good grade.  Very approachable and takes time out of her sched. to help you if you ask. Quite a bit of short story/essay reading.

DO NOT BUY THE BOOKS! Her class is extremely interesting, especially if you are a deep-thinker. I took the summer session, so it is soooo much work! Lots of papers and assignments! One powerpoint presentation at the end of the semester.

Do not take this class from this teacher. The book was never used, class discussions drift farther and farther away from the original topic as the class goes on. Very slow giving papers back but yet grades u on improvement which is not good.if u haven't seen your first paper how can you know what to improve on? A question I asked her numerous times but got no answer

I learned so much in this class about so many different things. Class discussions were deep, the reading and writing assignments were intense, but interesting and kinda fun. She is always willing to help. She makes you write a lot, but it is sooo worth it. And she's not too hard if you just put in a little work. Totally take her. It's an experience

Ms. Jones was a lot of fun! It took a while to get big papers back, but her comments were helpful. I actually learned to write better because of them. I've never gotten so much feedback from a professor. She told the best stories, which made the class a lot of fun, and she linked writing to critical thinking.  Take her!!! You will learn to think ab

Prof Jones is amazing. She makes you think outside the box, and she links writing to history, art, and philosophy and she comments on papers, which really helped my writing. She is an inspiring teacher and she actually cares about her students and will take extra time with you if you need it during the week and on weekends.

She's a nice individual but not a good teacher at all.  She can't keep her facts straight, gets off topic all the time, makes continuous alcohol references and I swear she forgot to grade like 4 assignments. She's impossible to contact outside of class and charges $45 an hour to look over a paper if not in class despite the fact that it's her job.

DO NOT BUY THE BOOK.  she said to read something in it once, but never spoke of it again.  She printed out what we needed before or put links online to them.  If not, buy it, but if she gives you them don't but it.

She makes you think, which for some may be difficult, but overall she is a good teacher.  She is odd, but very interesting.  She was a TBA teacher and I was happily surprised.  She makes you do a good bit of seemingly pointless responses to essays, but the class gets better.  If you actually enjoy writing and want feedback, take her.

Do not recommend. She is very scatter brained and forgets almost everything she tells you. Does not respond to e-mails and is not very up to date with Vista. Sometimes loses papers and is inconsistent with grading. Comes to class wearing strange outfits and likes to talk about dinner parties.

Professor Jones is pretty good. She has interesting discussions, and makes you think. She grades moderately and fairly. Although, she is VERY scattered. Half of time, I had no idea what was due when. I wouldn't mind taking her again, but just stay on top of assignments. You have something due every single day, which can take up a lot of your time.

This class is horrible. Way too scatter-brained to teach. The way she grades changes from assignment to assignment and is very inconsistent. Her essay topics are not clear at all. Looses many assignments also and says that you didnt turn it in. Assignments due everyday. Avoid.

Amazing is all I can say for her!  Level of class work is very small.  She will help you get an easy A if you work with her!  Her classes fill up far ahead of the other teachers!  She is great!  Sprint don't walk to get her as a prof!

Would absolutely never ever ever take her again.  The class discussions go in circles and are not helpful at all.  Every class there is an essay due, over some stupid liberal arts essay that no one understands.  I cannot WAIT for this class to be over, DO NOT RECOMMEND.
Awesome teacher, you won't regret taking her classes. If you fail a paper, she'll let you attempt to revise it for a C. Very helpful in class

Prof. Jones is a great teacher and you will not regret taking her.  Attendance is required but the class is relatively interesting so it did not bother me.  There are a few essays and assignments and as long as you go to her during office hours you will get A's on the essays, which is a big portion of your grade.  Don't buy the book it's never used
Absolutely loved this teacher!! best english teacher I have ever had. I definately recommend her to anyone!
Absolutely loved this teacher! She is the only teacher I have had to actually seems to care about her students. She is an amazing teacher and very understanding. LOVED HER!!

Holly Jones is Great! I was in her Fall Semester Class. At first she seems like a funny and wacky teacher, but some how she taught everyone in the class how to write amazing papers. When she told us that she was teach 1002 in the spring and she would tell us which classes she was teaching it was a mad dash in our class to get in her class first,lol

Professor Jones is a great teacher. Her views are a little out there but it's interesting. You do have to work so if you're a slacker, I wouldn't recommended Jones for you. She makes herself available for extra help and going to class helps, a lot.

I LOVED HER! This was the only class I went to everyday (attendance was mandatory), but I enjoyed going. She definitely expands your mind and makes you think! If you ask for help, she goes out of her way to help you. There are a good amount of essays, and you should take this class seriously, but it's worth it!

GREAT PROFESSOR!! Very helpful, makes her self available by phone, e-mail, and in person. A lot of writing but lets you know what is expected of you. She seems a little out there but she is very knowledgeable. I would totally take her again.

VERY GOOD TEACHER, I loved her class, She was easily one of the best english teachers i have ever had. She makes herself available on weekends to help. She is always willing to help, and her class can be easy if you work. Its not hard either, it just requires you put forth a little effort. TOTALLY LOVE THIS LADY GREAT TEACHER!

A previous rater stated it dead-on -- love/hate relationship. She has the knowledge and experiences to draw from, but her delivery could be polished. Her assignments are very interesting. She has a great personality, easy-going, laid back ... very willing to help. Makes herself avail. for extra help. Grades fairly. Take her class. Recommend.

You write alot of essays throughout the semester but she is extreemly helpful when it comes to going over them before she actualy grades them. She takes time out of her personal life to meet up and read your essay. Class is mandatory, she takes attendance everyday. She writes alot of notes on the board but i never wrote any down. she doesnt test yo

Probably one of the best professors at Kennesaw! She is truely brilliant. I got and A in her class. She is extremely helpful when it comes to papers... so set up appointments with her and she will let you know exactly what she wants in your paper. She has some awesome stories and amazing life experience. She is VERY good.
look for another class

Loves teaching, easy, doesn't like textbook so she rarely uses it DON'T BUY IT!!!, Will help you get an A or B if you really want it, fun, she makes you think, If you don't like your grade you can talk to her about it and she'll work with you on it to get a better grade, treats everyone equal, TAKE HER IS ALL I CAN SAY! Might be your easiest class!

I kind of had a love/hate relationship with her. She's extremely disorganized and scatterbrained, and that got to me a LOT!  BUT, she encourages critical thinking, creativity, logic, AND emotion. She values life and her students' opinions. She grades fairly and is a genuine person. So, while she lacks structure, she challenges you and helps you.

Great professor.  Her papers can be challenging, but she is always willing to help you with them.  She even offered me her number to help over the weekend.  Grades very fair and leaves super helpful comments on the papers.  Hilarious, too!  Would definitely take again.

Amazing professor!  She treats everyone with respect!  She has easy papers and even if they are hard she will work with you on them.  She made that clear from the beginning of the semester.  She truly has available office hours!  She is one of my favorite teachers and I would jump at the chance of taking her again!  Try to get her if you can Amazin

What a multi-dimensional composition class! You will write about very interesting, varied topics. Good discussions. Very nice woman, VERY interesting-tells funny stories. I grew very much as a writer/person during this class. Grades super fairly. Got an A.

If you're the type of person who wants to write about interesting things...this is definitely the teacher for you. At the end of the day, I can say I've learned a lot from her. I would recommend her to anyone. Shes awesome, makes you think, and easy to get along with. Shes there if you need her help and works around you.
I absolutely adored this professor. Although the papers that were assigned to be written were often difficult, she graded fairly and often helped my way through the challenges. highly recommended.

She was my favorite english teacher i have ever had.  She is very clear about what she wants, she is ALWAYS there to help you.  She'll go out of her way to make sure you understand.  She is a very smart lady, she used to teach History so she knows a lot!Flexible with deadlines. The paper topics are fun! Take her and you'll get an A (but work for it

WARNING WARNING WARNING!  Do not take this teacher!  She is useless.  She teaches a Philosophy Class for ENGL1101.  You will read short stories that make no sense and than you are expected to write a paper about it.  I don't mind a hard teacher, but this teacher does not help you with ANYTHING!  Oh, and she hates people who come in 5 mins late!

She is very helpful when you don't understand her assignments and will make time to work with you! Her personality is great; very funny and laid back. I enjoyed her class although I did not like writing the papers she assigned which was overwhelming for me. Other than that, it was good! P.S. She doesn't use the books often.

She is very helpful when you don't understand her assignments and will make time to work with you! Her personality is great; very funny and laid back. I enjoyed her class although I did not like writing the papers she assigned which was overwhelming for me. Other than that, it was good!

She is really easy.  As long as you do the work she'll work with you if you have a problem.  People have been late like 3 weeks and she didn't have a problem.  She also allowed you to rewrite a paper if you didn't get it and she'd give you the better grade.  She is also helpful and explains everything.  The paper's are easy (poems) and no final!!!!

Prof. Jones is amazing. She is a wealth of information, both related and not-so related to the topic at hand. She's very funny, grades very fairly and detailed, and is extremely fair about deadlines. 5 main papers with other smaller assignments sprinkled in.

Prof. Jones is very helpful.  I would recommend her to anyone.  She has you write about yourself so she can get to know you.  I know more about writing now and she made me realize that I thought I knew more about writing than I really did!

She is extremely helpful and makes you feel really comfortable.  She helped me alot with my writing.  She though is extremely fair and if you have a problem with an assignment she will give you alot of leverage.  For instance someone was 2 weeks late on an assignment and she just took like 10 points off.  She is really nice and helpful and easy!!!!

This Prof. is extremely nice!  She will work with you and truly has "office hours" and sits down in a one on one meeting to help you if you are struggling.  Yes, just in every case in English she has you write essays but yet it's fair.  One day we had a reflection paper on what we've learned in our lives.  We wrote a poem for our class.  AWESOME!!!
